Alternate Site Testing (AST) is blood glucose self-monitoring using a blood sample collected from somewhere other than the fingertips; the BG5 allows testing on the palm, forearm, upper arm, calf, or thigh with equivalent results to fingertip testing.
AST is appropriate in a pre-meal or fasting state (two hours or more after the last meal); two hours or more after taking insulin; two hours or more after exercising
Avoid AST if you think your blood glucose is low; you believe you may be hypoglycemic; you are testing for hyperglycemia; your routine glucose results fluctuate often; you are pregnant.
AST should not be used to calibrate CGMs; results from AST should not be used in insulin dose calculations.
Pain is felt less acutely at alternate sites because they have fewer nerve endings than fingertips.
Measures electrical current generated when glucose in blood reacts with test strip reagent; current strength corresponds to blood glucose level; meter converts current to glucose reading.
The Wireless Smart Glucose Meter and lancing device are for single patient use and should not be shared with anyone, including other family members.

Not for use on newborns; not for use on artery blood, serum, or plasma; not for patients in a hyperglycemic-hyperosmolar state (with or without ketosis); not for critically ill patients; not for patients who are dehydrated, hypertensive, hypotensive, or in shock; patients undergoing oxygen therapy may yield falsely lower results; very low or very high red blood cell count (hematocrit) can lead to incorrect results.
Never use your glucose meter with blood samples collected in a test tube; use fresh capillary blood only.
The iHealth Wireless Smart Glucose Meter is not intended for use on newborns.
The meter shows a message when blood glucose is lower than 20 mg/dl (1.1 mmol/L); the message indicates very low blood glucose—consult with your healthcare professional.
Blood glucose level is higher than 600 mg/dl (33.3 mmol/L); message indicates severe hyperglycemia; seek immediate medical assistance.
The environmental temperature is lower than 50°F; please test at a higher environmental temperature.
The environmental temperature is higher than 104°F; please test at a lower environmental temperature.
The error message indicating low battery is 'The meter's battery has insufficient power'; you should charge the battery.
The error message indicating 'Time has not been set' means the time has not been set; the fix is to connect IOS devices and synchronize time.

Battery power is too low; too much time has passed between inserting the test strip and performing the test; test strip not fully inserted. Charge the battery; reinsert the test strip; press firmly when reinserting.
Repeat the test with a new test strip; if the problem persists, call iHealth Labs Customer Service at +1-855-816-7705 for assistance.

Severe dehydration and excessive water loss may cause results that are lower than actual values; if blood glucose results are lower or higher than usual and you do not have symptoms, repeat the test; if you have symptoms or continue to get unusual results, follow your healthcare professional's advice; if symptoms are inconsistent with test results and instructions were followed, contact your healthcare professional.
